definition: to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup

sentences.english: He never got to the office late, like some important officials did, and he never procrastinated on any official duties.
sentences.chinese: 他从来就不像一些大官那样迟到，更不会延误公务。

sentences.english: At least the weather seemed unlikely to cause any significant delays on Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 至少，天气看起来不可能造成星期三任何明显的延误。

sentences.english: The problems with the wing and the  rotating joint could delay future missions.
sentences.chinese: 太阳翼和旋转接头的问题将延误未来的任务。

sentences.english: All the flights are delayed becaU3e of the heavy fog.
sentences.chinese: 趼有的航班都因为这场大雾延误了。

sentences.english: Expect long final approach R/W03, not delay.
sentences.chinese: 预计长五边进近跑道03号，不要延误。

sentences.english: Mercury is still retrograding so you may run into some delays.
sentences.chinese: 但水星仍然在逆行，因此你可能会遭遇延误。

sentences.english: And all those companies are plagued by backed-up orders and delivery delays.
sentences.chinese: 而所有这些公司都苦于订单堆积及交货延误。

sentences.english: Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria often goes unrecognized — its diagnosis may be delayed for more than 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 该病往往难以发现，诊断延误可达十多年之久。

sentences.english: Our order of leather shoes, which should have been delivered in June, is now considerably over due.
sentences.chinese: 我方订购的皮鞋应在六月交货，现已延误多日。

sentences.english: The delayed rate of newly registered smear positive patients was over 64%.
sentences.chinese: 新登涂阳肺结核病人延误为64%以上。

sentences.english: I must point out that further delay would be unwise.
sentences.chinese: 我必须指明再延误就要吃大亏了。

sentences.english: So you have to drive carefully and expect delays, you know.
sentences.chinese: 所以你要小心开车，要预料到时间会延误，你知道。

sentences.english: Every morning and evening she practiced her Buddhist devotions, and she never missed a day.
sentences.chinese: 她每天早晚礼佛，从没有一天延误。

sentences.english: Heavy rain and lightning, resulting in Chongqing Jiangbei International Airport flight delays.
sentences.chinese: 暴雨和闪电，致使重庆江北国际机场航班出现延误。

sentences.english: The shutdown reportedly caused numerous flights delays in and out of Newark, stranding thousands of passengers.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，许多航班因此延误，上千旅客滞留机场。

sentences.english: Entry of other ships has also been delayed at Paranagua port due to the strike.
sentences.chinese: 罢工还延误了巴拉那港其它船舶的入港时间。

definition: to affect adversely/to delay or hinder/to waste (an opportunity)/to mislead
not on time/late (public transport, airlines)/overdue/behind schedule/delayed
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
ahead of schedule/sooner than planned/to bring forward (to an earlier time)
